text: Hello and welcome back to Number Farm!

Farms are very busy places. Shall we have
a look at what happens during a whole week
at Number Farm?

Today is Monday and it is time for Farmer
George to milk the cows. He has brought the

cows into the milking parlour, and connected
his milking machines to the cows udders. The

udders are where the milk comes from, and
all of the milk from the cows gets collected
and bottled, ready to be put on your cereal!

It’s Tuesday today, and time to collect
the eggs from the Hen House. Shall we count

how many eggs the hens have laid in their
nests? There’s one, two, three, four, five.

Now, how shall we cook them? Boiled, scrambled,
fried or poached? What’s your favourite?

On Wednesday Farmer George is out driving
his Combine Harvester. A combine harvester

is a machine that harvests the crops that
grow in the field. In this field, Farmer George

has been growing Wheat which will then be
used to make things like bread to go on your
table!

Today is Thursday and Sammy the Sheep Dog
is training for his sheep dog trials. That

means he has to round the up the sheep into
the pen as quickly as possible. Ready steady…

GO! Come on Sammy - you can do it! Yay! Sammy
rounded up all the sheep in just 12 seconds.

Friday is a very rainy day, but the Ducks
don’t mind. Oh look Mummy duck has given

birth to some beautiful ducklings! Let’s
feed them some bread!

It’s Saturday and that means it’s the
weekend but work doesn’t stop on the farm!

It’s a very hot day so it’s time to give
the sheep a hair cut. Every few months, a

sheep’s coat will get too long, so the farmer
will shear the sheep’s coat with some clippers.

This is called sheep shearing, and stops the
sheep getting too hot in summer. The wool

from the sheep’s coat is used to make lovely
wooly jumpers that keep us warm in winter!

It’s Sunday, the last day of the week so
it’s time for some fun. Farmer George likes

to ride on his horses on a Sunday, and the
Harry the Horse loves galloping as quickly

as he possibly can! Wow, look at him go! Hold
on tight farmer George!

What a fun week on the farm. Can you remember
the days of the week?

On Monday, Farmer George milked the cows.
On Tuesday, we collected the eggs from the

hen house.
On Wednesday, Farmer George was harvesting

wheat from the field.
On Thursday Sammy the Sheep Dog rounded up

all of the sheep.
Friday was a rainy day and we fed the ducks.

On Saturday it was hot, so it was sheep shearing
day.

And on Sunday Farmer George went riding on
Harry the Horse.

Thanks very much for watching! Why not come
back to the farm and learn to count next?
